description: The harsh winter has seen Lake Erie become almost fully covered in ice.
title: WATCH: Satellite images reveal how Lake Erie has frozen over
title_page: WATCH: Satellite images reveal how Lake Erie has frozen over - BBC Weather
maintext:
It's been a harsh second half to winter for those living in the north of the US and eastern Canada.
Numerous surges of Arctic air have brought plunging temperatures and frequent snowfall. The impact can be seen not only over the snow-covered landscape, but also the frozen surface of parts of the Great Lakes.
Lake Erie, the shallowest of the lakes, is experiencing one of the highest levels of ice cover recorded in the last ten years.
How much ice forms on the lake varies from year to year. This year, ice is covering over 95% of the lake's surface, roughly an area the size of Wales. That's substantially above the average of around 67% for this stage in the year and far surpassing conditions of the last three years.
